required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Performance of AIR OPTIX® COLORS

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to assess the ocular response to and performance of the cosmetically printed silicone hydrogel contact lens AIR OPTIX® COLORS compared to FRESHLOOK® COLORBLENDS.

detailed_description.textblock: The study was conducted in two phases. Phase 1 was an adaptation phase where participants wore AIR OPTIX® AQUA contact lenses bilaterally (same product in both eyes) on a daily wear basis for 1 week. In Phase 2, participants wore AIR OPTIX® COLORS and FRESHLOOK® COLORBLENDS contact lenses contralaterally (different product in each eye) on a daily wear basis for 4 weeks.

arm_group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses worn in both eyes on a daily wear basis for one week in Phase 1.

Lotrafilcon B contact lens with color randomly assigned to one eye, with phemfilcon A contact lens with color in the fellow eye for contralateral wear. Both products worn on a daily wear basis for 4 weeks in Phase 2. A replacement phemfilcon A lens was dispensed at the Week 2 visit.

Phemfilcon A contact lens with color randomly assigned to one eye, with lotrafilcon B contact lens with color in the fellow eye for contralateral wear. Both products worn on a daily wear basis for 4 weeks in Phase 2. A replacement phemfilcon A lens was dispensed at the Week 2 visit.

intervention.intervention_name: Lotrafilcon B contact lens with color
intervention.description: Silicone hydrogel contact lens with color

intervention.intervention_name: Phemfilcon A contact lens with color
